faqs.question: Wie viel kostet diese Immobilie?
faqs.answer: €429,000. This 3-bedroom villa in Serena Golf represents exceptional value—40% less than comparable Spanish island properties while maintaining premium specifications. Payment options including mortgages are available to qualifying buyers.

faqs.question: Können Ausländer Immobilien in Spanien kaufen?
faqs.answer: Yes. Foreign nationals can purchase property in Spain without restrictions. EU citizens have full rights; non-EU citizens require a NIE (Spanish tax identification number) and may need a certificate of non-resident status. Professional legal support streamlines the process significantly. Most UK expats purchase through Spanish lawyers specializing in international transactions.

faqs.question: Welche Kosten fallen beim Immobilienkauf in Spanien an?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs in Spain typically total 6-10% of property price, including: transfer tax (6-10%), notary fees (1%), registry fees (0.5%), and legal fees (1-2%). Mortgage arrangement fees apply if financing. These costs are transparent and predetermined, unlike variable UK conveyancing.

faqs.question: Kann ich als Ausländer eine Hypothek in Spanien bekommen?
faqs.answer: Yes. Many Spanish banks and international lenders offer mortgages to foreign buyers. Terms typically allow 80% loan-to-value at competitive rates. EU citizens access rates similar to Spanish nationals. Documentation requirements include proof of income, employment contracts, and financial history. Professional mortgage brokers specializing in expatriate lending simplify the application process significantly.

faqs.question: Wie hoch sind die Lebenshaltungskosten an der Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca's cost of living is 30-40% lower than southern UK areas. Groceries, utilities, and dining out cost substantially less. Healthcare and education through state systems are minimal. Medications average 60-70% cheaper than UK prices. Property ownership costs less—combined with rental income potential, many families achieve cost-neutral or profitable ownership within 3-5 years.

faqs.question: Wie ist das Wetter an der Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys Mediterranean climate with over 300 days of sunshine annually. Summer temperatures reach 28-32°C (June-September); winter averages 15-18°C with occasional rainfall. Compared to UK, winters are dramatically milder without central heating demands. Spring and autumn provide perfect temperatures for outdoor family activities. The climate supports year-round beach access and outdoor living.

faqs.question: Ist die Costa Blanca ein guter Ort zum Immobilienkauf?
faqs.answer: Yes. Costa Blanca combines affordable pricing, strong rental potential, consistent market appreciation, established international communities, and exceptional lifestyle value. Unlike speculative resort areas, Los Alcazares represents authentic community growth with 8% annual property value increases. The region attracts families seeking sustainable relocation rather than investment flipping.
